title: Why King Charles III Is Not Going To Cop27
description: Prince Charles has been an outspoken advocate for the environment. Brits are puzzled as to why the government has recommended he doesn't attend Cop27.

title: New Apple Leak Reveals Disappointing MacBook Pro Details
description: If you have your hopes set on the new MacBook Pro models, there's some disappointing news about the larger macOS laptops.

title: Employee Happiness Is A Leading Indicator Of Profitability And Productivity
description: This blog focuses on employee happiness as a leading indicator of profitability and productivity. Numerous companies are profiled with helpful coaching for board directors and C-suite leaders that are concerned about the Great Resignation and Silent Quitting of employees.

title: History Of AI In 33 Breakthroughs: The First ‘Thinking Machine’
description: Catalan poet and theologian Ramon Llull perfected in 1308 his method of using paper-based mechanical means to create new knowledge from combinations of concepts.

title: Your next Outfit Could Be Made From Spider Silk
description: Researchers have been studying spiderwebs to understand what makes them so strong, and to learn from spiders how we can perhaps make similar materials. One of the most well-developed applications at the moment is in fabrics for clothing.

title: Neon Lighthouse Is A Bright And Colorful Tube Of LED Fun
description: The Moonside Neon Lighthouse can be thought of as a modern lava lamp with a sleek, modern look to it.

title: New Ecosystem Discovered In The Maldives: ‘The Trapping Zone’
description: A new ecosystem has been discovered 500 meters below sea level where sharks and other large fish swarm.

title: Crypto Law Experts Suggest SEC Likely To Lose Key Case And Discredit Howey Test
description: Ripple is ready to settle and pay fine if SEC declares XRP a currency, says company lawyer. Agency credibility, Gensler reputation at stake.

title: This Researcher’s Mission Is To Help Farmers Find A Hardier Apple
description: Agricultural researcher Awais Khan is now heading efforts to find new ways to breed apples that are resistant to disease, having grown up in a small town and worked on six crops across five continents.

title: Review: iottie Easy One Touch 5 Dash/Windshield Smartphone Mount
description: The iottie One Touch 5 dash/windshield mount provides a quality hands-free smartphone experience for your vehicle that is both adjustable and secure.

title: How Apple And U2 Made An Unforgettable Blunder, And Whose Fault It Was
description: Bono has now recounted an infamous muck-up when a U2 album snuck into everyone’s iTunes account.

title: Health Misinformation Is A Pandemic, and Social Media Is Desperately Trying To Navigate it
description: Social media has enabled rapid access to information; but this also brings with it many challenges.

title: Life On Earth May Have Started Here Repeatedly, Says Astrobiologist
description: It’s possible that life on Earth may have started here repeatedly and around the same time at different spots on the globe, says one prominent astrobiologist.

title: Social Media Users Love These Top Books For Fall
description: American Demon: Eliot Ness and the Hunt for America's Jack the Ripper.

title: Shipping Matchmaker Newtrul Lands Multi-Million Investment
description: Described by its CEO as a sort of Expedia or Stubhub for the trucking industry, Chicago-based Neutrul announced Monday it won millions in new investments.

title: Inflation Reduction Act Will Create 9 Million+ ClimateTech Jobs, New Report Says – Opportunities For Women
description: A new analysis by the BlueGreen Alliance & the Political Economy Research Institute at the University of Massachusetts Amherst found that the Inflation Reduction Act will create over 9 million climatetech jobs by 2032. These roles are typically held by men, but there’s a silver lining for women.

title: Destiny 2’s Storm Grenade Build Is One Of The Most Ridiculous Of All Time
description: I know at this point in the season, the existence of this Destiny 2 Titan Storm Grenade build is kind of old news, but I figured I should write it up at least once, as I have a feeling it may not survive to next season.

title: Netflix’s ‘Cabinet Of Curiosities’ Is Worth Your Time And Perfect Halloween Viewing
description: Netflix is certainly pretty hit or miss with whatever comes racing up or down its Top 10 lists these days, but every so often they get it just right. That’s certainly the case with Cabinet of Curiosities, the Guillermo del Toro passion project

title: Marvel’s ‘Eternals’ Will Return, According To ‘Black Panther’ Producer
description: Eternals has the unfortunate distinction of being the only “rotten” MCU movie ever made, but over time, it has found a soft spot in the hearts of many fans, fans who rate it above quite a few other MCU movies that they deem worse. A classic audience/critic split.

title: Warning: ‘God Of War Ragnarok’ Leaks Explode As Retailers Break Street Date
description: They dodged hacks, insider reports and (mostly) embargoed review copy leaks, but now, Sony Santa Monica and God of War fans have fallen victim to: idiot retailers breaking the street date and selling Ragnarok two weeks early.

title: Tundra Esports Wins The International 11 ‘Dota 2’ Tournament
description: The team takes home around $8.5 million after beating Team Secret in the grand final

title: Henry Cavill’s ‘Witcher’ Exit: Superman Related Or Show Problems?
description: While difficult, it’s not impossible for actors to juggle a TV show with movies. And we know that Henry Cavill was absolutely, enormously passionate about playing Geralt on The Witcher, so there’s extra motivation for him to make that work somehow, and not leave the series unfinished.

title: Does macOS Stage Manager Work With The Dock On The Side?
description: Stage Manager is the big visual change in macOS Ventura, but what happens if you put your Dock on the side of the screen? Find out here

title: Forget The 2022 Apple iPad Pro: New Leak Predicts Stunning Upgrade

title: AMD Monster Radeon RX 7900XTX Graphics Card Rumored To Take On NVidia RTX 4090
description: Powerful new graphics card from AMD to have 24GB memory

title: The Great Resignation: The Unhappiness Age Must Shift To The Happiness Age
description: This blog discusses The Great Resignation and that The Unhappiness Age Must Shift. Mainly focused on USA labor trends and costs of attrition, and reasons why the great exit persists and is growing. Focus on Happiness and Management Leadership is key to turn the tide. Are you ready?

title: The Argument For An AI Augmented Workforce
description: Companies will apply AI to the work that humans either should not, will not, or can not do, making the workplace safer and more efficient than ever before.

title: ‘Saturnalia’ Review: The Best Horror Game For Halloween 2022, And Beyond
description: ‘Saturnalia’ may not look like much, and it won’t hold your hand, but this Italian indie is a masterclass in horror gaming.

title: Former U.K. Prime Minister Liz Truss’ Phone Allegedly Hacked By Kremlin Spies: Report
description: It has been reported that the personal phone of former U.K. Prime Minister, Liz Truss, was hacked by cyber-spies working for the Kremlin.

title: Flu Season: British Parents Urged To Vaccinate Kids As Hospitalizations Rise
description: Levels of other winter diseases are also on the rise.

title: FDA: Here’s Yet Another Blood Pressure Medication Recall For Cancer Concerns
description: This time the potential cancer-causing contaminant is Nitrosamine Drug Substance Related Impurity (NDSRI), N-Nitroso-Quinapril.

title: Mars Retrograde 2022: The Biggest, Brightest (And Backwards) Phase Of The Red Planet Begins Today
description: As of today the planet Mars will reverse its apparent west-to-east movement in the night sky and begin moving from east-to-west against the background stars. It's also going to look its best for over two years.

title: Is New Senate GOP Covid-19 Pandemic Origin Report More About Politics Than Science?
description: The report from the office of Richard Burr (R-NC) claimed that "the COVID-19 pandemic was, more likely than not, the result of a research-related incident." But what evidence did the report actually provide?
